events.event_name: Q4 2025 Indonesia Residential Property Price Survey
events.description: The release of residential property price data for the fourth quarter of 2025, showing record low growth.

facts.fact_text: Indonesia's residential property prices rose by 0.83% year-on-year in Q4 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Residential property prices in Indonesia rose by 0.83% year-on-year in Q4 2025

facts.fact_text: Property price growth in Q4 2025 was the slowest since the data series began in 2003.

evidences.evidence_text: marking the slowest growth since the data series began in 2003

facts.fact_text: Price growth for medium-sized houses slowed to 1.12% in Q4 from 1.18% in Q3.

evidences.evidence_text: Price growth slowed for medium-sized houses (1.12% vs 1.18% in Q3)

facts.fact_text: 12 out of 18 cities surveyed reported slower price growth.

evidences.evidence_text: Among the 18 cities included in the survey, 12 reported slower price growth

facts.fact_text: Property prices in Manado decreased by 0.04% in Q4 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: prices in Manado edged down by 0.04% after rising 0.03% in Q3

claims.claim_text: A decline in purchasing power and an increase in layoffs contributed to the moderation in property prices.

evidences.evidence_text: The latest figures reflect a decline in purchasing power and a rise in layoffs, which contributed to the overall moderation in property prices.

evidence.evidence_text: The latest figures reflect a decline in purchasing power... which contributed to the overall moderation in property prices.
a rise in layoffs, which contributed to the overall moderation in property prices.
a rise in layoffs, which contributed to the overall moderation in property prices.
